title: Notes by the Way; or, what I saw in my rambles
author: Higginson, H. Talbot.
snippet: The Great Park comprises about ten thousandacres, and is well stocked with deer. It contains the Model Farm, theCumberland Pillar, and the King's Oak, twenty-six feet in circumference. I was at a school kept by a clergyman near Bray, about four milesfrom Windsor, but we afterwards removed to Bedfordshire, nearDunstable, where they make the famous straw bonnets, and whereBaron Rothschild had his fine castle, and from that the school was re-moved to Hampshire, as our master removed to different livings.

title: St. Paul's to St. Sophia;
author: McCormick, Richard C.
snippet: There are two or three very large farms connected with the Castle. One is known as the " Shaw Farm," and one as " Prince Albert's Model Farm ;" for Bis Eoyal Highness pretends to be a practical farmer. Indeed, I believe his love is much stronger for plowshares and pruning-
